title: The Best Smart Remotes for Your Specific Needs
text:
Is there anything more satisfying than controlling a device from halfway across the room?



The latest smart remote technology gives users unprecedented control and access to their entertainment—and much more.



Below are our picks for brightest remotes for any given need.



Caavo Control Center + Universal Remote



In this era of endless entertainment devices and infinite streaming services, even downtime can be a daunting task. Fortunately, Caavo is here to amass and arrange your myriad content streams into an easily accessible system. Via the Control Center, Caavo allows users to plug in their many platforms, from Apple TV to XBox One, Sonos to Playstation and everything in between.



Users can also search across devices and services for specific movies, music, actors, TV shows and more, without having to navigate through different apps or login credentials. The Caavo Control Center is even smart enough to recognize when you pick up a gaming controller and automatically switches to the accompanying gaming system. How do you navigate the Caavo system? By the Caavo Universal Remote, a sleek and streamlined piece of hardware that also acts as a microphone, allowing owners to literally call forth “Colin Firth movies” whenever they want to watch “Love, Actually.”



The Caavo Control Center + Universal Remote costs $49, but users will want to pay for the Lifetime Service plan ($99) for the Control Center to take advantage of the device’s most attractive features, such as universal search and voice control.



Logitech Harmony Hub



The Harmony Hub Logitech

Perhaps the perfect remote was with you all the time—in your pocket, in fact. With the Logitech Harmony Hub, users can transform their smartphone into a universal entertainment remote, allowing them to change channels, alter the volume, program favorites and navigate streaming services on their televisions, all via a device that is rarely if ever out of their hands. Harmony Hub is also compatible with smartphone-based A.I. assistants like Amazon Alexa and Google Home, meaning yelling at your TV won’t just be reserved for football games anymore.



The Logitech Harmony Hub is available for $99.



Unified Remote



The ever-expanding prevalence of cord-cutting also means the rise of computers over TVs as a primary viewing device for many entertainment consumers—and if you think that makes a wireless mouse your best option as a remote, we have some good news. Unified Remote is an app, compatible across Windows, Mac, iOS, Android, Linux and more, that gives you complete remote control over your computer—its media, programs, files, power and more—all from your smartphone. Easily pause Netflix, turn up the volume or start a Skype call, all from across the room with a simple tap on your smart device of choice.



Unified Remote is free to download via the Apple, Google Play and Windows store.



Sevenhugs Smart Remote



When is a universal remote truly a universal remote? When it’s the Sevenhugs Smart Remote. This clever controller gives power over every connected device in your home—and yes we mean every connected device.



Compatible with over 650,000 products and services, users operate the Smart Remote as you would remotes of yore, pointing it directly at the connected device you want to control—be it a TV, speakers, lights, locks or more—and bending it to your will. Smart Remote owners will find the device a breeze to use, because while it maintains the retro remote shape, the controller functions are all conducted via a simple and straightforward touchscreen operating system.



While the Smart Remote allows users to wield control over individual devices one-by-one, owners can also easily set up “scenes” through the accompanying Sevenhugs app that pair several different device functions together. Once these scenes are established, they will become available on the remote itself and launched by a single button touch.



The Sevenhugs Smart Remote is available for $199.
